Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma
Indication_FDA: Treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma

Indication_CDSCO: For palliative treatment of patients with persistent or recurrent ovarian cancer, following first line therapy with cisplatin and/or alkylating agent based combination.
Indication_FDA: Single agent palliative treatment of patients with persistent or recurrent ovarian cancer following first-line therapy with a cisplatin and/or alkylating agent based combination.

Indication_CDSCO: For the “treatment of patients with metastatic colorectal cancer (CRC) who have been previously treated with fluoropyrimidine-, oxaliplatin- and irinotecan-based chemotherapy, an anti-VEGF therapy, and, if KRAS wild type, an anti-EGFR therapy”.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with locally advanced, unresectable or metastatic gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) who have been previously treated with imatinib mesylate and sunitinib malate.

Indication_CDSCO: For induction of remission and consolidation in patients with acute promyelocytic leukemia.
Indication_FDA: For induction of remission and consolidation in patients with acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL) who are refractory to, or have relapsed from, retinoid and anthracycline chemotherapy, and whose APL is characterized by the presence of the t(15;17) translocation of PML/RAR-alpha gene expression.
FDA_Sponsor_Company: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products R&D, Inc.

Indication_CDSCO: For the short treatment of apnoea of prematurity in infants between 28 and <33 weeks gestational age.
Indication_FDA: Short term treatment of apnea of prematurity in infants between 28 and less than 33 weeks gestational age.

Indication_CDSCO: In the treatment of narcotic antagonist and alcohol dependence.

For the treatment of; i) Adult patients with newly-diagnosed glioblastoma multiforme concomitantly with radiotherapy (RT) and subsequently as monotherapy treatment. Ii) Children from the age of three years, adolescents and adult patients with malignant glioma.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of adult patients with refractory anaplastic astrocytoma, i.e., patients at first relapse who have experienced disease progression on a drug regimen containing a nitrosourea and procarbazine

Indication_CDSCO: Relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma i) Carfilzomib for injection is indicated in combination with dexamethasone or with lenalidomide plus dexamethasone for the treatment of patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma who have received one to three prior lines of therapy.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with multiple myeloma who have received at least two prior therapies including bortezomib and an immunomodulatory agent and have demonstrated disease progression on or within 60 days of completion of the last therapy.

Indication_CDSCO: As an antidote for Ethylene glycol or Methanol used poisoning or for use in suspected Ethylene glycol or Methanol ingestion, either alone or in combination with hemodialysis.
Indication_FDA: As an antidote to ethylene glycol (antifreeze) poisoning, or for use in suspected ethylene glycol ingestion.

Indication_CDSCO: Additional indication-abnormal bleeding in which local hyperfibrinolysis is considered to be involved (pulmonary, haemorrhage, epistaxis, renal bleeding abnormal bleeding during or after prostate surgery).
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with hemophilia for short term use (2 to 8 days) before and after tooth extraction to reduce or prevent hemorrhage and reduce the need for replacement therapy

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of cranial diabetes insipidus, primary nocturnal enuresis in patients.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with hemophilia A or von Willebrand's disease (type I) whose factor VIII coagulant activity level is greater than 5%.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of advanced gastric carcinoma.
Indication_FDA: For the second line treatment of AIDS-related Kaposi's sarcoma.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of patients with advanced Soft Tissue Sarcoma (STS) who have received prior chemotherapy.
Indication_FDA: Advanced soft tissue sarcoma (STS) who have received prior chemotherapy

Indication_CDSCO: In combination with Granulocyte Colony Stimulating Factor (G-CSF) to enhance mobilisation of hematopoietic stem cells to the peripheral blood for collection and subsequent autologous hematopoietic stem cell transplantation in patients with non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma and multiple myeloma.
Indication_FDA: To enhance mobilization of hematopoietic stem cells to the peripheral blood for collection and subsequent autologous transplantation in patients with lymphoma and multiple myeloma

Indication_CDSCO: Endometriosis and central precocious puberty only (for gynaecologist only)
Indication_FDA: Treatment of central precocious puberty (gonadotropin-dependent precocious puberty) in children of both sexes.

Indication_CDSCO: In combination with bortezomib and dexamethasone, is indicated for the treatment of patients with multiple myeloma, who received at least 1 prior therapy.
Indication_FDA: FARYDAK (panobinostat) in combination with bortezomib (BTZ) and dexamethasone (DEX) for the treatment of patients with multiple myeloma who have received at least 2 prior regimens, including bortezomib and an immunomodulatory agent.

Indication_CDSCO: For the use in Indolent B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (NHL) that has progressed during or within six months of treatment with rituximab or a rituximab containing regimen.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of Indolent B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) that has progressed during or within six months of treatment with rituximab or a rituximab-containing regimen.

Indication_CDSCO: By cancer specialist for the treatment of patients with relapsed or chemo resistant indolent B cell non-Hodgkin's lymphomas.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with relapsed or refractory low-grade or follicular, CD20 positive, B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

Indication_CDSCO: For the long term treatment of adult patients with Gaucher disease type 1 who are CYP2D6 extensive metabolizers, intermediate metabolizers, or poor metabolizers as detected by an appropriate test.
Indication_FDA: Long-term treatment of adult patients with Gaucher disease type 1 who are CYP2D6 extensive metabolizers (EMs), intermediate metabolizers (IMs), or poor metabolizers (PMs) as detected by an FDA-cleared test.

Indication_CDSCO: For acute treatment of the cutaneous manifestation of moderate to severe erythema nodosum leprosum and for the treatment of multiple myeloma.
Indication_FDA: Acute treatment of the cutaneous manifestations of moderate to severe erythema nodosum leprosum (ENL) and as maintenance therapy for prevention and suppression of the cutaneous manifestations of ENL recurrences.

Indication_CDSCO: By hospital, nursing homes, institution only. For prophylaxis in acute organ rejection in patients receiving transplants.
Indication_FDA: Prophylaxis of acute organ rejection in patients receiving renal transplants, to be used as a part of an immunosuppressive regimen that includes cyclosporine and corticosteroids.

Indication_CDSCO: Anti cancer.
FDA_Sponsor_Company: R. W. Johnson Pharmaceutical Research Institute

Indication_CDSCO: For osteoporosis.
As a monotherapy and in combination with Dabrafenib for the treatment of patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E mutation as detected by an appropriate test.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E or V600K mutations as detected by an FDA approved test.

Indication_CDSCO: Used in severe malaria including cerebral malaria and as a second line chloroquine resistant malaria cases only.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of acute malaria due to Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax

Indication_CDSCO: For the prophylaxis of acute organ rejection in de-novo transplantation and is to be used concomitantly with cyclosporin for microemulsion and corticosteroid immunosuppression.
Indication_FDA: Prophylaxis of acute organ rejection in patients receiving renal transplantation when used as part of an immunosuppressive regimen that includes cyclosporine and corticosteroids.

Indication_CDSCO: In the treatment of patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (motor neurone disease).
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Riluzole extends survival and/or time to tracheostomy.

Indication_CDSCO: "For the treatment of adult patients with Cushing’s Disease for whom Pituitary surgery is not an option or has not been curative".
Indication_FDA: Treatment of adult patients with Cushing's disease for whom pituitary surgery is not an option or has not been curative

Indication_CDSCO: As a single agent for the treatment of patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E mutation as detected by an appropriate test. In combination with Trametinib for the treatment of patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E mutation as detected by an appropriate test.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E mutation as detected by an FDA approved test.

Indication_CDSCO: Indicated as a chemoprotective agent against the serious toxicities associated with intensive regimens of platinum and alkylating agent chemotherapy (on reconstitution each ml will contain 50mg amifostine).
Indication_FDA: To reduce the cumulative renal toxicity associated with repeated administration of cisplatin in patients with advanced ovarian cancer.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of anorexia, cachexia, or an unexplained, significant weight loss in patients with a diagnosis of cancer or acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).
Indication_FDA: Treatment of anorexia, cachexia, or an unexplained significant weight loss in patients with a diagnosis of acquired immune deficiency syndrome.

Indication_CDSCO: For treatment of radiation induced xerostomia in patients undergoing radiotherapy of head & neck cancer and in patients with Sjogren's syndrome.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of symptoms of xerostomia from salivary gland hypofunction caused by radiotherapy for cancer of the head and neck.

Indication_CDSCO: For treatment of patients with myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) including previously treated and untreated, de novo and secondary MDS of all French-American-British subtypes.
Indication_FDA: For treatment of patients with myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) including previously treated and untreated, de novo and secondary MDS of all French-American-British subtypes and intermediate-1, intermediate-2, and high-risk International Prognostic Scoring System groups.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of systemic helminth infections: Neurocysticercosis, Echinococcosis.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of parenchymal neurocysticercosis due to active lesions caused by larval forms of the pork tapeworm, Taenia solium.

Indication_CDSCO: For the relief of bladder pain or discomfort associated with interstitial cystitis.
Indication_FDA: Relief of bladder pain or discomfort associated with interstitial cystitis.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of patients with mantle cell lymphoma who have received at least one prior therapy.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of multiple myeloma patients who have received at least two prior therapies and have demonstrated disease progression on the last therapy

Indication_CDSCO: For additional indication; for the treatment of V-cell chronic lymphocytic leukaemia (CLL) in patients with sufficient bone marrow.
For treatment of pulmonary T.B only in patients co-infected with HIV. (It should never be used as a substitute to Rifampicin in T.B patients without HIV co-infection).
Indication_FDA: Prevention of disseminated Mycobacterium avium complex disease in patients with advanced HIV infections.

Indication_CDSCO: Hypercalcemia induced by various malignant disorders.
Reduction of signs & symptoms of moderate to severe active rheumatoid arthritis in patients who have had an inadequate response to one or more disease modifying antirheumatic drugs
Indication_FDA: Reducing signs and symptoms of moderately to severely active polyarticular juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) in patients ages 2 and older.

Indication_CDSCO: For reduction in risk of overt hepatic encephalopathy (HE) recurrence in patients ≥ 18 years of age.
Indication_FDA: Reduction in the risk of overt hepatic encephalopathy (HE) recurrence in patients greater than or equal to 18 years of age.

Indication_CDSCO: Control and induction procedure in cattle and pig reproduction. Therapy of ovarian infertility disorders or dysfunctions of the reproductive organs in cattle and horses.

In adults (≥ 18 years), as part of combination therapy of pulmonary tuberculosis due to multi-drug resistant Mycobacterium tuberculosis when an effective treatment regimen cannot otherwise be provided.
Indication_FDA: Part of combination therapy in adults (greater than or equal to 18 years) with pulmonary multi-drug resistant tuberculosis (MDR-TB).

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAFV600E mutation as detected by an FDA-approved test. Vemurafenib is not recommended for use in patients with wild-type BRAF melanoma.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of unresectable or metastatic melanoma with the BRAFV600E mutation as detected by an FDA-approved test.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of milk fever, hypocalcaemia tetanies and disorders of calcium metabolism in dairy cattle.
For the reduction of the frequency of relapses in patients with Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis.
Indication_FDA: For reduction of the frequency of relapses in patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis.

Indication_CDSCO: Additional indication: 24 week treatment regimen in the subgroup of hepatitis-C (genotype-1) low viral load, patients, who are HCV RNA negative of 4 weeks treatment.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of chronic hepatitis C among previously untreated pediatric patients at least three years of age or older.
Treatment of diarrhea caused by Cryptosporidium parvum and Giardia lamblia

Indication_CDSCO: In combination with cisplatin is indicated for the first line treatment of patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer other than predominantly squamous cell histology.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of patients with malignant pleural mesothelioma whose disease is either unresectable or who are otherwise not candidates for curative surgery.
Supression of severe diarrhea and flushing associated with malignant carcinoid syndrome.

Indication_CDSCO: Febrile Neutropenia in cancer patients.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of visceral leishmaniasis.

Indication_CDSCO: Indication for the treatment of progressive neuroendocrine tumours of pancreatic origin (PNET) in patient with unresectable, locally advanced or metastatic disease.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of progressive neuroendocrine tumors of pancreatic origin (PNET) in patients with unresectable, locally advanced or metastatic disease.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (WHO Group I) in patients with WHO class II or III symptoms to improve exercise capacity and delay clinical worsening.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (WHO group I) in patients with WHO class II or III symptoms to improve exercise capacity and delay clinical worsening.

Indication_CDSCO: 1. For the treatment of erectile dysfunction. 2. For the treatment of erectile dysfunction with benign prostatic hyperplasia.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (WHO Group I) to improve exercise ability.

Indication_CDSCO: For the treatment of symptomatic orthostatic hypotension.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of symptomatic orthostatic hypotension.

Indication_CDSCO: Indicated for adjuvant treatment of Post Menopausal Women with estrogen receptor positive early breast cancer who have received two-three years of tamoxifen and are switched to exemestane for completion of total of five years of adjuvant hormonal therapy.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of advanced breast cancer in postmenopausal women whose disease has progressed following tamoxifen therapy.

Indication_CDSCO: Parkinsonism- Indicated in the treatment of Parkinson's disease.
Short stature due to inadequate or failed secretion of pituitary growth hormone.
Indication_FDA: Treatment of short stature in patients with Noonan syndrome.

Indication_CDSCO: 1) In newly diagnosed high-grade malignant glioma patients as an adjunct to surgery and radiation. 2) In recurrent glioblastoma multiforme patients as an adjunct to surgery.
Indication_FDA: As an adjunct to surgery to prolong survival in patients with recurrent glioblastoma multiforme for whom surgical resection is indicated

Indication_CDSCO: Anti-tuberculosis.
Indication_FDA: Short-course treatment of tuberculosis.

Indication_CDSCO: To improve wakefulness in patients with excessive sleepiness associated with treated obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), shift work sleep disorder (SWD) or narcolepsy.
Indication_FDA: Improve wakefulness in patients with excessive daytime sleepiness associated with narcolepsy.
